ceas 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

    Organize Seahorse Data

    partition_data.Rd

    Organizes Seahorse OCR and ECAR rates based on defined time points (i.e. the Measurement column) during the experiment. This time point can be specified if you are modifying the Mito and Glyco Stress Test (i.e. from 3 measurements per cycle to X measurements)

    partition_data(
  seahorse_rates,
  basal_tp = 3,
  oligo_tp = 6,
  maxresp_tp = 8,
  nonmito_tp = 12,
  maxgly_tp = 6,
  fccp_ecar_tp = 8,
  basal_ecar_tp = 3,
  oligomon_ecar_tp = 8
)

    Arguments

    seahorse_rates

    data.table Seahorse OCR and ECAR rates (imported using read_data function)

    basal_tp

    Must be less than oligo_tp

    oligo_tp

    Must be less than maxresp_tp

    maxresp_tp

    Must be less than nonmito_tp

    nonmito_tp

    Must be larger than maxresp_tp

    maxgly_tp

    Must be the same as oligo_tp

    fccp_ecar_tp

    Must be the same as maxresp_tp

    basal_ecar_tp

    Must be the same as basal_tp

    oligomon_ecar_tp

    Must be larger than basal_ecar_tp

    Value

    a list of named timepoints from each assay cycle

    Examples

    rep_list <- system.file("extdata", package = "ceas") |> list.files(pattern = "*.xlsx", full.names = TRUE)
seahorse_rates <- read_data(rep_list, sheet = 2)
partitioned_data <- partition_data(seahorse_rates)
